entry.title: Game: Downwell (Steam, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Downwell (Steam, 2015)20160123
I played this game for about an hour and had a blast. It is taking
a while, but I'm getting a feel for how it works and how to play
it properly. I got about 10k in gems. I can't tell if I need to
unlock more "styles" to win at the game or if it is really just
for flair.

Total time: 0:56
  • Video Games
  • Downwell
  • Steam
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (9)20160123
I finished the game today. My crazy weapon got even crazier as I
used fragmenting missile ammo. Now when I shoot, the screen is
basically completely filled with bullets. It's awesome. I did the
remaining levels and fought the final boss twice. The end of the
game felt a little bit anti-climatic and the final set of levels
was really easy with my super-powered gun.

Overall, I found this game to be totally amazing and
inspiring. What an awesome job.

Total time: 26:23
  • Video Games
  • Mercenary Kings
  • Steam
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Furious 7, starring Vin Diesel (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Furious 7, starring Vin Diesel (2015)20160123
This was another fun crazy Fast & Furious movie. I found it to have
a lot more "WTF" moments than the previous ones as lots of
non-sense plot holes were ignored. The character of Ramsey was
especially dumb as she is nothing but a McGuffin then a hard
body... she has no development and her inclusion in the crew at the
end strains credulity. The number of butts in the movie was much
higher than usual. There were lot of things that I assumed would
happen that didn't as well: like Hector's crew helping in LA or
Kurt Russell back-stabbing, etc. It was a very odd movie.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (8)20160122
I played for a long time today and got to the last rank. (Although
there's still one mission of the second-to-last rank that I need
to do.) I upgraded my equipment quite a bit and now my gun is very
powerful and has an almost instantaneous reload, which is pretty
awesome. I turned on rapid-fire on my Joy2key configuration and it
feels really cool to use a pistol like a machine gun. :) I still
think this game is so rad. The Tiny Computer boss was very clever.

Total time: 23:33
  • Video Games
  • Mercenary Kings
  • Steam
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Pixels, starring Adam Sandler (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Pixels, starring Adam Sandler (2015)20160121
Obviously, this is a totally stupid movie in lots of
ways. Nevertheless, there were lots of cute bits in the movie. I
like the idea of the president being a goof-ball with his
friends. The whole term "Arcader" is so stupid and
ridiculous. Michelle Monaghan looked so good. It was clever that
Dinklage's character looked like Billy Mitchell and that they got
Iwatani & Martha Stewart in the movie (what I weird thing!) The
whole Lady Lisa thing was really weird too---how she is literally a
trophy wife and never speaks. I noticed that Dan Aykroyd was in the
movie along with his Crystal Skull vodka.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (7)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (7)20160120
I only have a few missions left of Lt. Colonel. Some of them were
very difficult, but also fun and rewarding. I'm continually blown
away by how tight the controls on this game are and how just a few
different enemies types can bring so much fun. I'm at a very hard
part of the game though and I feel like I just keep barely
scraping by. When I play with other people and I get paired with a
n00b, I wish I could switch who was the "master" and help them on
their levels rather than push them into the hard areas that I'm
on.

Total time: 19:33
  • Video Games
  • Mercenary Kings
  • Steam
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (6)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (6)20160119
I played for quite a while tonight. I mostly did my own missions,
but some people did join to help me, which was nice. I did a
little bit of farming of some specific items that I wanted to
upgrade my weapon. I feel like I wish I had more resources in the
game to experiment more with different weapons. I feel like it
could almost work if the game had you unlock "tiers" of
attachments so you had a lot of experimentation, but didn't have
to break the bank and make the grind unbearable.

Total time: 16:51
  • Video Games
  • Mercenary Kings
  • Steam
  • 2014

entry.title: Movie: Focus, starring Will Smith (2015)
entry.content:
Movie: Focus, starring Will Smith (2015)20160119
This was a visually cool movie with lots of neat little moments. I
like the tons of twists and how crazy the scheme is. I feel like it
was really confusing at the end though, but I kind of appreciate
how it was willing to go to a weird place. I think the biggest
problem was that there's really no explanation give for why he
leaves her in the first place... I suppose he's worried about being
"soft"? It doesn't seem that credible.
  • Movies
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (5)20160118
I played for a while today and did a lot of missions with another
person, but I was much higher level than them, so I was blasting
through the missions getting them big rewards. I did that for
almost an hour, which in retrospect was probably too long because
I didn't get much reward from it. This game is soooo good.

Total time: 13:33

entry.title: Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Mercenary Kings (Steam, 2014) (4)20160117
I played a lot today and made lots of progress. I went up two
ranks and unlocked a lot more different gun types. I tried a few
different kinds of gun configurations... like a shotgun and a
peashooter, but I didn't really like them. Eventually I went back
to the handgun and explored some different features on it. Right
now I'm using homing missiles, which are pretty neat.

Total time: 10:22

  • Mercenary Kings
  • Steam

entry.title: Book: Proof of Heaven: A Neurosurgeon's Journey into the Afterlife, by Eben Alexander (2012) (2)
entry.content:
Book: Proof of Heaven: A Neurosurgeon's Journey into the Afterlife, by Eben Alexander (2012) (2)20160116
I'm finding this book more and more aggravating. The pattern is:
long chapter about the medical story of his coma and then short
chapter about his NDE. The NDE chapters are very very short, often
just one page and they mostly contain pseudo-profound BS that could
have been generated by a program.
  • Books
  • 2012
